reference_utils¶

Functions¶

def getAllReferences()

def getReference()

def getReferencePath()

def getReferenced()

def getTopReference()

def isReference()

def isReferenced()

Description¶

Reference operations in Maya.

Basics¶

A reference node is created for each child scene when it is referenced into a parent scene. The reference node is responsible for tracking any changes made to the referenced child nodes within the parent scene. When a parent scene is referenced into another parent scene, a multi-level hierarchy of references is created. The hierarchy of reference nodes tracks changes made to descendant references and allows them to propogate through to the ancestral scenes.
msTools.core.maya.reference_utils.getAllReferences(referencedNode)¶

Return the reference node hierarchy of a referenced node that may be nested within a multi-level reference hierarchy.

Parameters:referencedNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a referenced dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If referencedNode is not a referenced dependency node.
Returns:list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers for the reference node hierarchy of referencedNode. Ordered from outer reference node –> inner referenced node.
msTools.core.maya.reference_utils.getReference(referencedNode)¶

Returns the direct reference node for a referenced dependency node.

Note

If referencedNode is itself a reference node, the parent reference node will be returned.

Parameters:referencedNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a referenced dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If referencedNode is not a referenced dependency node.
Returns:OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper for the direct reference node of referencedNode.
msTools.core.maya.reference_utils.getReferencePath(referenceNode, includeCopyNumber=False)¶

Return the filepath associated with the reference file of a reference dependency node.

The filepath will be resolved, meaning updated since the reference was loaded.

Parameters:
  • referenceNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a reference node.
  • includeCopyNumber (bool) – Whether to include a copy number in the filepath, used to delineate duplicate references. The initial reference is not assigned a copy number. Duplicate references are assigned a copy number, starting at {1} for the first duplicate.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If referenceNode is not a reference node.
Returns:

str – Filepath for the loaded reference file of referenceNode.
msTools.core.maya.reference_utils.getReferenced(referenceNode)¶

Return the referenced nodes for a reference node.

Parameters:referenceNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a reference node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If referenceNode is not a reference node.
Returns:list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers for the referenced nodes of referenceNode.
msTools.core.maya.reference_utils.getTopReference(referencedNode)¶

Return the top level reference node for a referenced dependency node that may be nested within a multi-level reference hierarchy.

Parameters:referencedNode (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a referenced dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If referencedNode is not a referenced dependency node.
Returns:OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper for the top level reference node of referencedNode.
msTools.core.maya.reference_utils.isReference(node)¶
Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not references a dependency node.
Returns:bool – True if node is a reference node, otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.reference_utils.isReferenced(node)¶
Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not references a dependency node.
Returns:bool – True if node is a referenced node, otherwise False.
